reviews.title: Relaxing
reviews.text: We traveled in March actually, service was very good, rooms were rustic but well appointed (although a bit dark).

reviews.title: Elegant yet comfortable
reviews.text: Restaurants on premises were good and so was the service. My only slight gripe would be the spa. A necklace i had was "misplaced", and therefore the poor rating for both the spa and the service.

reviews.title: Over the top hotel and service
reviews.text: Despite this I think its a great trip, although for the time traveled and being from NY my husband and I would first think of going to Canada again.

reviews.title: Relaxed and Pampered
reviews.text: We have enjoyed several club level stays in a spacious suite at this location. It's one of our favorites- we love the service and food on the club level, and the kids love the pool. The hotel restaurants are fine, but we usually drive to beaver creek for dinner and year round outdoor ice skating. The decor is elegant but comfortable, and we always make sure we spend some time with the hotel mascot, Backelor the dog. Good hiking, badminton, and location keeps our family happy while here.

reviews.title: Attention to detail - SUPERB!
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Ritz Carlton Bachelor Gulch. We are Marriott Gold members so we were able to enjoy the Club Lounge. It had a gorgeous lounge and impeccable food choices. We are vegetarian and have a wheat allergy and the staff made special dishes to serve our needs.

reviews.title: Wonderful property, exquisite service!
reviews.text: From check in to check out service was extraordinary. Friendly, helpful, solution oriented. Hotel itself is in perfect setting for summer or winter. Dining was top shelf. Spa was tremendous.

reviews.title: Very disappointed
reviews.text: Prices are high. it is expensive. No knock off on ratings, because the experience was remarkable.

reviews.title: Truly lovely hotel that treated a loyal customer like a liar
reviews.text: This was our first time at a Ritz Carlton. The hotel itself is a beautiful lodge. But I reserved a king bed way before our trip and they informed me they overbooked. It's not fair for someone who plans their trip. They gave us a room with 2 small double beds and took 50% off the bill. Okay, that helped, but we could not sleep together in such a small bed. Once in the room we wanted a drink, and in the room refrigerator all the orange juices had expired dates. Had to call to correct that. Then later in the evening, there was water leaking from somewhere and we had a wet carpet in a portion of the room we had to place a towel over. Had to call to correct that. The room coffee cups did not match and then finally, our in-room breakfast came without the room bill to sign. We've stayed at other 5-star resorts. This may sound fussy, but for a top-notch resort it was very disappointing in lack of attentiveness.

reviews.title: Perfection...once again
reviews.text: I wrote the following letters to the Ritz Carlton in January/February 2011 and subsequently had a follow up interaction with Debi Howard at corporate headquarters. This issue has yet to be resolved and our last communications with both the property and Debi Howard were not even followed up on. Have only stayed one night at a Marriott property since this incident despite a history of 527 nights stayed in a Marriott property over the past 10 years.

reviews.title: Awesome Spot
reviews.text: I've lost all faith in the Ritz Carlton brand...

reviews.title: Amazing ski in, ski out resort!
reviews.text: Beautiful resort with gorgeous rooms and views. We loved all of the amenities, including the resteraunts on location. It's a bit far from the town center, but there is a very easy to use shuttle service which makes getting down there a breeze!

reviews.title: Average at best...
reviews.text: While the staff was very accommodating, the property was very mediocre. We woke up at 1am to a very audible conversation of those in the room next to us. They weren't even being loud, but we could hear every word of their conversation. Aside from the paper-thin walls, we weren't able to control the temperature of our room. It was hot all night long. Whether you're spending money or points, your resources are better spent at the Marriott Vail property.

reviews.title: Surprised, but not in a good way...
reviews.text: I travel a lot and stay at a lot of hotels, the front desk staff at this hotel needs to learn a lot about customer service and how to NOT be insulting.

reviews.title: Luxuriously Casual!
reviews.text: We got to the hotel earlier than we expected and there were no clean room available for us, we did the check in process without getting an actual room and then left for a couple of hours. When we returned we were told that rooms with King beds (which we were guaranteed to get) were very limited, they asked if we would take a room with a double bed, I would not and they put us in a room 2 floors below the lobby. I should have wondered about that room immediately since it was on the 2nd floor and we were supposed to have a room with a "resort view", but I decided to trust that they knew what they were doing, man was I wrong! Our "view" was 2 walls, tarps and paint buckets!! We went back up stairs to complain and when the clerk couldn't find another room for us he called over someone else and she pipped in that "technically that IS a resort view", I told her that was insulting and false advertisement, she asked if we would take a room with a double bed (again) and I said not, she put us in a room on the same floor with a mountain view (although she told us it was a "resort view" again, it was right next to the street so we got to listen to the cars drive by until late that night. At that point I was tired and hungry and didn't want to argue with them anymore so we stayed in that room and went out for dinner. The room itself was nice, clean and cozy, it's just not what we reserved and being insulted at check in made the whole experience a bad one. They had overbooked that weekend (seems to be a common problem here) and that was the issue with getting us what we reserved.

reviews.title: I want to go back so badly!
reviews.text: Bottom line is if you book here, be prepared to not receive what you book, lower your expectations and you will be fine :-)

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: We spent a mid-October weekend here and had a truly wonderful and remarkable time. While this is "shoulder season," between summer and ski season, the accommodations and staff were nonetheless awesome. We took our dog with us and the staff could not have been more professional, polite and warm.

reviews.title: So relaxing
reviews.text: Upon our arrival, the doorman and valets were professional, calling us by name, helpful and took the time to pet the dog and provide us with any information we needed.

reviews.title: Beautiful resort and location with average service
reviews.text: The front desk staff was also very polite and friendly. He made sure we would be provided everything we needed, including information on the food service (Spago was closed since it was shoulder season), what to do, recommendations for day hikes and what was going on in Beaver Creek Village and Vail. He also made sure we had dog bowls and a bed for the dog.

reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the Ritz Standard
reviews.text: In the evenings, someone was always available to keep the wonderful fire on the ski patio going and making sure everyone had marshmallows to roast and drinks were kept full.

reviews.title: A Great Hotel
reviews.text: While Spago was closed, the Buffalo Bar provided food, as well as a limited sushi menu. The food was well prepared and the sushi fresh and the staff obviously worked hard to ensure everyone was happy.
